(Requires attunement by a creature. The properties of this item are affixed to a weapon.)

This item is a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.rules.JournalEntry.nniVtdJB1oyk5Sa3]{locus} and can be combined with other Loci per the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.rules.JournalEntry.nniVtdJB1oyk5Sa3.JournalEntryPage.zI0VWGKnYZqz6sKd]{Combining Loci} rules.

This cut stone transitions from hues of violet to fuchsia. When moved quickly it leaves a similarly colored, harmless poof of fine particles.

While attuned, the stone magically merges with a weapon of your choice, transferring its color scheme. This can be done during a short or long rest, and requires 10 minutes to complete. Once completed, the weapon becomes magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances.

Effect: If the weapon is nonmagical or magical but does not grant any bonuses to attack or damage rolls, it gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it and any creature it hits takes an extra 1d4 psychic damage. When the damage you deal with this weapon would reduce a creature to 0 hit points, you can choose to magically cause it to fall asleep, instead of dealing the damage. The sleeping creature is unconscious for 10 minutes, until it takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap it awake.

When you cause a creature to fall asleep in this way, you can also force it to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + 2 x your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, you immediately learn its surface thoughts and can decide what dreams it has while asleep. Once a creature falls asleep in this way, it is immune to this effect for the next 24 hours.
